body:
Hi Eric,

I already turned off the Sunpath shading component's outputs. You didn't have to turn it by yourself. Sorry if my explanation wasn't good enough.

For baking: by default, when Ladybug components geometry is baked, the last parent layer is turned off. So what you have to do is to turn it on.
Sometimes you even have to turn off the very last child layer. I think this may be a bug with Rhino.
Also make sure that you choose **Shaded** or **Rendered** display mode instead of **Wireframe**. Here is a screenshots of the mentioned steps: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/NsUCuETiBEvbFaLDj79NgQ6HCdG2EXvqZ4ex*meyaQEJMugOoaI0jk3FnKAv7KesKlKCy0GCgVwJNAXorB2V6S-mRSqxFtr7/baking_Sunpath_Shading_geometry.jpg) For the isocurves issue: the file I attached in my last reply creates them. Here is a screenshot: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/NsUCuETiBEslAJ4hXjCUsA53b7BpA8fE6dAFCY5kNr*5Mvj15PPtTRalTT-pMuywTVlc3y3Y2329NTvl4yslxAmVUrATMr2G/TOF_Oslo.jpg) Can you please post a screenshot of what you are getting?
